revised_title: Biosynthesis of Porphyrins, Chlorophyll, and Vitamin B: Experimental and Theoretical Aspects
tldr: The article discusses the biosynthesis of porphyrins, chlorophyll, and vitamin B using carbon-14 labeling techniques. It explores the use of 1H-Fourier transform nuclear magnetic resonance to observe the incorporation of carbon-14 into these molecules. The study confirms the specific and intact incorporation of urogen III and the origin of the methyl groups in these molecules, providing insights into their biosynthetic pathways.
